page.title: 01HISTORY OF SCISSETT
page.content: In the first Domesday book Scissett was merely a large woodland area. Gradually the woodland was cleared away. Space was needed for Nortonthorpe and Wood Street mills in the early 1800's. Later in that century more of this wood was cleared to make way for pasture land for Lower Busker farm. In 1825 Joseph Norton purchased most of the land on which the village now stands. He used water power to drive scribbling and fulling machines and his business supplied yarn to out- weavers from whom he collected finished goods. At that time the main A636 road was the Denby Dale to Wakefield Turnpike. Joseph Norton built a row of houses known as The Fleet.
